009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.utils;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013
014import java.util.Random;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
018
019/**
020 * Utility class for picking random points on a given circle. 
021 * @author WB
022 *
023 */
024public class CircleSampler {
025        
026        private final Random rg;        
027        private final GeometricCircle circle;
028        
029        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle) {
030                this.circle = circle;
031                this.rg = new Random();
032        }
033        
034        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle, long seed) {
035                this.circle = circle;
036                this.rg = new Random(seed);
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates and returns an array of 2D points sampled on 
041         * the circle associated with this {@link CircleSampler}.
042         * Random Gaussian noise (with standard deviation sigma)
043         * is added to the individual x/y coordinates.
044         *
045         * @param n          number of points to sample
046         * @param startAngle initial angle (in radians)
047         * @param endAngle   final angle (in radians)
048         * @param sigma      sigma of Gaussian noise
049         * @return an array of sample points
050         */
051        public Pnt2d[] getPoints(int n, double startAngle, double endAngle, double sigma) {
052                double xc = circle.xc;
053                double yc = circle.yc;
054                double r = circle.r;
055                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
056                
057                startAngle = mod(startAngle, 2 * PI);
058                endAngle = mod(endAngle, 2 * PI);
059                double dAngle = (endAngle >= startAngle) ? 
060                                (endAngle - startAngle) :
061                                (endAngle + 2 * PI - startAngle);
062                
063                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
064                        double alpha = startAngle + dAngle * i / n;
065                        double x = xc + r * Math.cos(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
066                        double y = yc + r * Math.sin(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
067                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
068                }
069                return pts;
070        }
071
072}
